results.title: Pitcha this : life stories from A.S.H.E (Shepparton) : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: Brian Beckhurst, Chris Mansfield, Daniel McCrimmon, Helen Atkinson, Joel Atkinson, Misty Briggs, Natasha Craig, Tammy-Lee Atkinson, Troy Lovett, ACMI Digital Storytelling, VicHealth and ACMI
results.brief_description: Nine stories of the lives of students from Shepparton’s A.S.H.E (Academy of Sport, Health and Education), as created by the students as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling program. These students, also members of the Indigenous community, tell of their loves, ambitions and, mostly, of the family that support and sustain them.
results.title_for_label: Pitcha this : life stories from A.S.H.E (Shepparton) : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Beckhurst, Chris Mansfield, Daniel McCrimmon, Helen Atkinson, Joel Atkinson, Misty Briggs, Natasha Craig, Tammy-Lee Atkinson, Troy Lovett, ACMI Digital Storytelling, VicHealth and ACMI

results.title: Pitcha this : the black cockatoos (Swan Hill) : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: Anna Williams, Daniel Edwards, Judith Rigney, Marion Beeton, Patty Donaczy, Ramptha Edwards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Six stories from members of the Swan Hill Indigenous community. Parents, children and inspirational family members are celebrated in these stories, connecting the participants to their heritage.

results.title: My tribe
results.creator_credit: Judith Rigney, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Judith Rigney’s family are the love of her life. At age 22, Rigney gave birth to her first child. Here she proudly and lovingly pays tribute her ‘tribe’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Judith Rigney, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Cape Barren boy
results.creator_credit: Marion Beeton, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Marion Beeton is proud of his father, Clive Beeton. A talented musician who wrote his own songs, he learnt to play the guitar through listening to the wireless.

results.title: Digital Storytelling workshop : general public (March 2007)
results.creator_credit: Alfred Zerfas, Christine Lamb, Edwin Whiting, Joyce Evans, Llywellyn Staiff, Louise Blake, Lyn McLeavy, Martin Zerfas, Sally McCutcheon, Sonya Waters, Sue Silk, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Eleven stories from members of the general public. Mostly autobiographical, they are stories that concern themselves mostly with the passions of the creator, whether social issues, history, hobbies or family. These passions and interests are what makes the participants who they are.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alfred Zerfas, Christine Lamb, Edwin Whiting, Joyce Evans, Llywellyn Staiff, Louise Blake, Lyn McLeavy, Martin Zerfas, Sally McCutcheon, Sonya Waters, Sue Silk, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Pitcha this : just our mob from Gippsland : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: Amy Dowd, Barbara Tilley, Ben Yarram, Bess Yarram, Bindie Jack, Daphne Yarram, Emily Yarram, Karen Milward, Linda Kennedy-Baxter, Norman Terrick, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ten members of the Gippsland Indigenous community share their stories. The stories, while biographical in form, are mostly centred on the theme of family, of belonging in a community and how both these things contribute to a sense of identity.
results.title_for_label: Pitcha this : just our mob from Gippsland : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit_for_label: Amy Dowd, Barbara Tilley, Ben Yarram, Bess Yarram, Bindie Jack, Daphne Yarram, Emily Yarram, Karen Milward, Linda Kennedy-Baxter, Norman Terrick, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: When does work end?
results.creator_credit: Daphne Yarram, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Daphne Yarram gives a candid account of her life, helping the abused, poor and unfortunate in her community, trying to make things better for her mob. Despite feeling satisfaction helping her community, Yarram also feels lonely and tired at times.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Daphne Yarram, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: My life with Noel
results.creator_credit: Bess Yarram, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Bess Yarram shares the things closest to her heart. After meeting her husband in bording school, he joined the army and, from then on, the family moved with him. There was always room for one more foster child in this family but Yarram wouldn’t have been able to cope if it wasn’t for the support of the older women, the mothers and aunts that provided support and guidance.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bess Yarram, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Bess Yarram shares the things closest to her heart. After meeting her husband in bording school, he joined the army and, from then on, the family moved with him. results.title: Digital Storytelling workshop : general public (June 2010)
results.creator_credit: Barbara Lemon, Deborah Horne, Jimmy Pasakos, Melanie Steptoe, Penny Morison, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: These five stories were created by members of the general public as part of a Digital Storytelling workshop at ACMI. On the most part, the stories are tributes to the people in the participants families that have been important or inspiring them. They employ a variety of storytelling techniques that best convey the emotion and intention of the stories.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barbara Lemon, Deborah Horne, Jimmy Pasakos, Melanie Steptoe, Penny Morison, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
